children.value: This is the fourth project of Wes Bos's
We will be creating a bunch of small examples to play with various array methods such as

.embed-container { position: relative; padding-bottom: 56.25%; height: 0; overflow: hidden; max-width: 100%; } .embed-container iframe, .embed-container object, .embed-container embed { position: absolute; top: 0; left: 0; width: 100%; height: 100%; }
Here is the codepen with the starter files
See the Pen JS30-04-Array-Cardio-a by Deepak Karki (@deepakkarki) on CodePen.
Here is the data we have
So now we have a few lists and maps to work on (provided with the template), let's tackle the problems one by one!
method creates a new array with all elements that pass the condition implemented by the provided function (
). Each element of the array is iterated upon and passed to
returns a "truthy" for the element, it is included in the new list, if it returns a "falsey", it is not. Learn more @
Filter the list of inventors for those who were born in the 1500's
method creates a new array with the results of calling a provided function (

) on every element in the calling array.
Learn more @
Give us an array of the inventor first and last names
method sorts the elements of an array in place and returns the array. You can pass an optional function as an argument (
), which will be used to compare two elements with each other. The

takes in two arguments - each being an element of the array being sorted.
The compare function -
should return a value lesser than 0 if 'a < b'. ('a' will be placed at a lower index than 'b')
should return a value equal to 0 if 'a == b'    ('a' and 'b' will remain where they are wrt each other)
should return a value greater than 0 if 'a > b' ('b' will be places at a lower index than 'a')
Sort the inventors by birthdate, oldest to youngest

is passed) and each element in the array (from left to right) to reduce it to a single value. Example -
